Today, at my weekly press conference, I told reporters that I want to hear the truth from Special Counsel Mueller today. We have a responsibility to protect our nation’s elections from Russian interference, understand what happened in 2016, and prevent it from happening again.

One of the proudest moments of my life was when I stood nearby President George H.W. Bush when he signed the ADA into law 29 years ago, & I will continue to work with AAPD to fight for access, equality, and full inclusion for every single American, regardless of physical ability.

The last federal minimum wage increase was in 2009.
The #RaiseTheWage Act would gradually raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour.
The current minimum wage is $7.25 an hour.

The House will pass the #RaiseTheWage Act today, and I hope the Senate will pass it as well. A pay raise for American workers is long overdue, and it’s time we raise wages for the people, as Democrats promised. Today we’re keeping that promise.  https://bit.ly/32yXGWj  pic.twitter.com/ELtwpqoLIi

It’s time to #RaiseTheWage for women and families in #MD05 and across the country. Over 20 million women will benefit from the #RaisetheWage Act, especially women of color who make up 40% of the workforce and face higher rates of wage discrimination.

I brought the last minimum wage increase to the House Floor for a vote, and I’m proud the House will pass the #RaiseTheWage Act today to gradually increase the federal minimum wage to $15/hour. Action is long overdue. I urge @HouseGOP to join us in supporting this bill. pic.twitter.com/Wa1ZlxrLb6

Too many families across the country are working hard, but struggling to make ends meet. That’s why the House will pass the #RaisetheWage Act today to gradually raise the federal minimum wage and lift 1.3 million Americans out of poverty, including 600,000 children. pic.twitter.com/qRiNe6E638

Shakiera Pearson from Brandywine told me before her current job as a trained construction craft laborer, she worked minimum wage jobs to support her 4 kids. She knows what it’s like to worry about making ends meet & wants Congress to #RaiseTheWage to help families like hers. pic.twitter.com/vydiQczoIv

Victor Reyes of Berwyn Heights has a union construction job. He started his career as a non-union day-laborer and told me that he wants Congress to pass the #RaiseTheWage Act so that the individuals he works with can have the same economic security he has now.

Families throughout #MD05 will benefit from the #RaiseTheWage Act. Delano Alexander from Clinton is an environmental services aide at Prince George’s Hospital Center making $12.85 an hour. Increasing the minimum wage to $15 will help him and his family get ahead.

The #RaiseTheWage Act will help thousands of Marylanders like Dana Hudson from Owings. Dana works at Safeway to supplement his income as a farmer and help pay for medical expenses for his wife. A higher minimum wage would give Dana and his family more financial stability. pic.twitter.com/eW5Ych6HjI

I’m voting for the #RaisetheWage Act to give nearly 81,000 workers in #MD05 a long-overdue pay raise. Marylanders across our state are working hard to make ends meet and deserve to earn a wage that will allow them to get ahead.

On Thursday, House Democrats will make good on our promise to raise wages when we pass the #RaisetheWage Act. Learn how this bill will raise wages for workers, lift families out of poverty, and strengthen the economy: https://bit.ly/2SpcwKo
Lastly, I said House Dems are working to reach an agreement to pay our nation’s bills and prevent another #TrumpShutdown. The Admin wants a short-term solution – that is unacceptable.

I also told the press the House will pass the #RaisetheWage Act on Thursday. House Dems are making good on our promise to the American people to raise wages. This bill will increase wages for 27 million Americans and lift 1.3 million out of poverty.

At my weekly press conference, I told reporters the House will vote on a resolution condemning @POTUS’s racist comments. Our diversity makes us stronger & he cannot & will not change that. I hope many House Republicans join us in condemning the racist nature of his comments.

#MD05 is on track to experience severe heat through the rest of the week. Be prepared and stay safe. I encourage everyone to check on their neighbors and vulnerable family members, stay hydrated, and watch for heat illness. https://twitter.com/NWS_BaltWash/status/1151151188127232000 …

The 10 million Americans who have paid into multi-employer pensions deserve to know they will receive the benefits they’ve earned when they retire. Next week, the House will consider the Butch Lewis Act, which will help ensure a secure retirement for these workers and retirees.

Tomorrow, the House will vote on the resolution introduced by @RepMalinowski and @RepRaskin to condemn the President’s racist, xenophobic tweets. I hope Republicans put country before party and vote with us in support of the resolution.

Appreciated the opportunity to welcome Mr. and Mrs. Collins to my office this afternoon. We continue to grieve the loss of 2nd Lt. Richard Collins III, & @repanthonybrown & I will continue to work to ensure his memory is honored with the respect he deserves. pic.twitter.com/ezDsnEWxUc

Proud to support @RepAdamSchiff’s resolution that passed the House today that recognizes the growing threat toward freedom of expression and freedom of the press – freedoms that are vital to democracy.

Today, the House passed @RepDanKildee’s resolution to condemn the attacks toward peaceful protesters in #Sudan and call for an immediate, peaceful transition to a civilian-led government. The U.S. continues to stand with those calling for democracy & a peaceful transition.

Our asylum laws are clear: those fleeing violence or disaster are allowed to present themselves at our borders & ask for an asylum hearing. The Admin’s new rule to deny asylum seekers’ claims is a violation of our asylum laws. I urge @POTUS to reconsider. https://bit.ly/2Jyp6E2
Happy birthday to my friend, @RepLipinski of #IL03. Thanks for your work as Chair of the @TransportDems Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, & Hazardous Materials.

Deeply disappointed Ambassador @KimDarroch resigned. He did an outstanding job serving his country. We need ambassadors to be honest and give their best counsel and advice. I wish him the best as he moves on to his next chapter.

Finally, I told press that the GOP-led lawsuit to strike down the #ACA would force 20 million Americans to lose health coverage. The first act taken by the Dem-led House was to defend the #ACA, and I believe the courts will rule in favor to #ProtectOurCare.
I told press that Republicans ought to vote for the #NDAA because it supports our troops and strengthens national security. I hope they will vote with us and not politicize a national defense bill.

At my weekly press conf, I said we will vote on the #NDAA & to #Renew911VCF this week. Next week, we’ll vote to #RaiseTheWage & consider the Intel auth bill & Saudi arms sales legislation. It’s also possible we’ll vote to hold the Admin in contempt of Congress on the Census.
